results.title: Professor Erikson. Part 2
results.creator_credit: James L. Brown and KUHT Film Productions
results.brief_description: An investigation of some theories of psychoanalysis, and personality growth in relation to the work of Dr Erik Erikson, of Harvard University, a pioneer in the field of child analysis and research. Part 2 deals with the Libido theory, Ego-identity, Identity crisis, Positive and negative identity, existentialism, cross-cultural research, fixation and the value of psycho-therapy. The ensuing discussion touches upon Erikson’s relationship to the theories of Freud; additions and modifications to subsequent theories; the crisis of adolescence; and the problems facing psycho-analysis today.

results.title: Professor Erikson. Part 1
results.creator_credit: James L. Brown and KUHT Film Productions
results.brief_description: An investigation of some theories of psychoanalysis, and personality growth. The film takes the form of an interview between Dr Erik Erikson, of Harvard University, a pioneer in the field of child analysis and research and Dr Richard Evans, of the University of Houston. They discuss Erikson’s theory of the eight stages of psycho development. Part 1 and 2 produced under a grant awarded by the national Science Foundation, USA.

results.title: Professional Development
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Institute of Educational Administration
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Case studies in effective schooling”.
Case studiesin effective schooling presents first hand accounts of how individual schools have gone about improving their effectiveness. “Professional development” is the second part in the series and records the manner in which Ivanhoe East Primary School supports its educational program with a coherent, planned program of professional development for its staff.

results.title: Profession of arms
results.creator_credit: Tina Viljoen, Michael Bryans and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “War”.
(War series 3) This video is about professional soldiers - the career officers in every country who devote their lives to maintaining military organizations and nurturing the attitides that go with them.

results.title: Profession of arms
results.creator_credit: Alex Ezard and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: Life as a cadet at Duntroon - history and background. Shows National War Museum at Canberra and Duntroon - Australias only military college - established in 1911, as part of a defence plan recommended by Field Marshall Lord Kitchener. Royal Military College is an intensive four year course in academic and military training affiliated with the University of NSW.

results.title: Produktionsfrasmaschine PFV 140
results.brief_description: Setting up a large automatic machine tool device. Follows the loading of the program, and various switch settings. The material to be processed is placed in position of the processing platform and the operation commences.

results.title: Products of Broken Hill
results.brief_description: Describes the mineral products of Broken Hill, the methods of processing the ore, and the refining of lead at Port Pirie and zinc at Risdon, Tasmania.

results.title: Productivity primer
results.creator_credit: Bob Godfrey and Biographic Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: A consideration of two issues - what is productivity and why does it matter. To employ more married women, postpone retirement, bring in immigrant workers are some suggested ways of increasing Britain’s output.

results.title: Productivity is people
results.creator_credit: Michael Robertson, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A case-study in management - employee relations based on the concept of a productivity improvement team. In the course of the film the team members express their personal views on advantages of the concept.
